Articles.Content:
Hey guys. Ive been working on this for a while now but i think its now time to post it. I have made a fully stock Mars Constellation.

Everything is 100% stock however some sections are about 2100 parts at launch so I suggest you use mechjeb just to launch it of the ground. Once in space it wont have as many when the sections are docked together. I don't have many picture since I'm still testing everything but I promise I'll later on post more pictures and a video.

Aerobraking

Jeb enjoying the view before going in capsule to transport him to the lander.

The launchers are from ethan829 on this thread

Here and here are some albums of the landers being tested on kerbin however they have had some minor changes.

How to get everything to Duna?

1. To get everything to Duna you would have to do a regular burn from kerbin to Duna.

2. You have to go for a direct aerobrake on Dumas atmosphere at 12.5km out.

3. The MTV and the Hab Lander would then circularize their orbit at 44 km circular orbit. The Cargo lander would get it's periapsis down to 10 km to make a perfect landing.

4. Later on the the Hab Lander would only burn 10.5 m/s retrograde from the 44 km orbit. This is the perfect landing sceneario because you would be left with a little bit of fuel on your de orbiting engines to slow you down by another 11 m/s before deploying parachutes and activating landing engines.

DOWNLOAD

MechJeb

Edited April 1, 2014 by astroadrian99
How to get to Duna orbit and land Landers?
Wow, this is very impressive. I will definitely be doing this (But smaller) Using 0.23.5, as dem bosters and new parts will be absolutely perfect for constellation mission remakes.

Yes, please more pics.

I'll try to post more pics this or next weekend. Depends on how much HW I get.

Wow, this is very impressive. I will definitely be doing this (But smaller) Using 0.23.5, as dem bosters and new parts will be absolutely perfect for constellation mission remakes.

That's what I'm planning on doing but couldn't wait anymore for the update and decided to post it already.
This looks amazing, must have taken a great lot of work. Though I can't help but think that 4 skippers are overkill for the ascent vehicle

This looks amazing, must have taken a great lot of work. Though I can't help but think that 4 skippers are overkill for the ascent vehicle

Hahaha yeah it has taken a lot of work. I started this around the beginning of December but is been hard for me since I have so much school work and my computer is very slow but it's worth it.

Yeah the 4 skippers are kind of overkill but I got them mostly for the looks. I wanted it to be as close as the ones on the video.
